title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: Partners
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Partners             Partners       Pacific Historic Parks Pacific Historic Parks (PHP), our cooperating association, is a non-profit organization created to support the interpretation, education, research, and related visitor service activities of the National Park Service at four sites across the Pacific region:  World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument - Pearl Harbor, Hawaii War in the Pacific National Historical Park - Guam American Memorial Park - Saipan Kalaupapa National Historic Park - Molokai, Hawaii    In addition, PHP operates the bookstore at the Pearl Harbor Visitor Center.  PHP makes interpretive and educational materials available to park visitors for sale through their bookstore, mail order and membership programs. The income generated from sales is used to support the research, interpretation, and conservation programs of the National Park Service. The Pearl Harbor Memorial Fund supported the construction of the Pearl Harbor Visitor Center and its museum and interpretive exhibits through generous contributions from the public. An Endowment Fund has been created to support continued operations at the Pearl Harbor Visitor Center.
